meanings.definition: To arrange or order in a sequence
meanings.sent1: She will ordinate the books on the shelf by size.
meanings.sent2: Please ordinate the numbers from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to ordinate themselves in a line based on height.
meanings.sent4: The chef will ordinate the ingredients for the recipe like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: He carefully ordinated the puzzle pieces to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: A value on a coordinate axis
meanings.sent1: The point (3, 4) is an ordinate on the y-axis.
meanings.sent2: The x-ordinate represents the horizontal position on the graph.
meanings.sent3: The ordinate of the graph showed the temperature changes throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: The ordinate on the map indicated the elevation of the mountain.
meanings.sent5: She marked the ordinate where the two lines intersect on the graph.

meanings.sent1: The manager will ordinate the team members to start the project.
meanings.sent2: He ordinated the troops to march in formation.
meanings.sent3: The coach will ordinate the players on the field during the game.
meanings.sent4: She ordinated the volunteers to help with the event smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The captain ordinated the crew to prepare the ship for departure.
